question: 風
userAnswer:
<tag>かぜ:</tag> wind/breeze | draft | <ja>風邪</ja>
<tag>ふう:</tag> manner/way/style | appearance/air
activeAnswer:
<tag>かぜ:</tag> wind/breeze | draft | <ja>風邪</ja>
<tag>ふう:</tag> manner/way/style | appearance/air
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Do you know the word "kamikaze" from WWII history? Well, it means "divine wind." The "kaze" part is the wind part, and this word uses the same reading, making it <ja><reading>かぜ</reading></ja> as well.
